abstracts.cdata!:
The project was rated as follows:
            Project outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; and the
            performances of both the Bank and the Borrower are
            satisfactory. Lessons learned include: The Bank should stay
            continuously engaged during critical periods to help sustain
            ongoing reforms and protect previous achievements. Within a
            difficult lending and operational environment, focusing on
            the consolidation of ongoing reforms was an effective
            strategy. Past institutional relationships matter,
            particularly during periods of crisis. It is difficult to
            advance significant social protection reforms during times
            of extreme fiscal crises. Crises do not always offer windows
            of opportunities for new reforms. Information technology can
            effectively improve public management. While SAL operations
            can be effective tools in establishing the legal framework
            for the exchange of information across different agencies,
            they have to be complemented with strong political support
            from top authorities to successfully overcome institutional
            resistance and adequate consensus building mechanisms. Loan
            conditionality should focus on results, and go beyond the
            enactment of legislation or executive decrees. Overly
            complex operations are difficult to implement and supervise.

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Structural Adjustment Loan
            Project : Release of Tranche and Waiver of Three Conditions

abstracts.cdata!:
This memorandum seeks Board approval for
            the release of the second tranche and waiver of conditions
            set due to the dramatic crisis Argentina has undergone. It
            summarizes the macroeconomic policies in place since early
            2002, the overall progress in implementing the reform
            program supported by the Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL)
            Project, and the actions taken by the Government of
            Argentina to meet specific conditions for release of the
            second tranche. However, three conditions were not met:
            namely a) reduction of the consolidated provincial fiscal
            deficit for 2001, b) implementing changes in the calculation
            of non-contributory pensions, and c) implementing a new
            system for the payment of family allowances. Waivers are
            proposed for the above three specific conditions, based on
            the overall strong implementation of the program and in view
            of the continuing macroeconomic stabilization, markedly
            improved fiscal performance of the provinces, the progress
            towards implementing a new payments system for family
            allowances, and the legal obstacles to the original pension
            reform measures.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Loan is
            intended to support the Argentine's government's
            structural reform program within a coherent medium-term
            framework over the 2001-2003 period. Loan objectives are to
            improve the quality, equity, and efficiency of social
            services and to reduce fiscal instability in the
            federal-provincial public sector. Such reforms are needed to
            secure sustainability of the economy. Expected benefits
            include: 1) improved fiscal stability across levels of
            gocvernment; 2) improved stability in the level of social
            services provided by the public sector especially those
            targeted to the poor; 3) improved efficiency, equity, and
            quality of health insurance services; 4) improved
            effectiveness of federal and provincial social protection
            programs in reaching the poor; 5) improved equity and
            financial sustainability of the national public pension
            system; and 6) improved efficiency of tax administration.
            One or two follow-up adjustment operations are planned
            within the medium-term framework, depending upon progress in
            implementing the continuing reform agenda.
